intro: Eriope crassipes subsp. crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved eriope, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptive traits to arid environments.
